posts.post_content: So here's a question: If you had two Nemesis of Reason cards in play and you attacked with both of them, would the defending player have to discard 40 cards instead of 20 because the text on each card refers to the name "Nemesis of Reason" instead of say something like, "When this creature attacks..."?
posts.html:
So here's a question: If you had two Nemesis of Reason cards in play and you attacked with both of them, would the defending player have to discard 40 cards instead of 20 because the text on each card refers to the name "Nemesis of Reason" instead of say something like, "When this creature attacks..."?
Report Abuse  
Posted By: 1DeadDrad (6/19/2009 9:39:06 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: To the guy asking if attacking with two of them mills 20 or 40: it mills 20. When a card mentions it's own name in the text, it refers only to itself, not to other copies.
posts.html:
To the guy asking if attacking with two of them mills 20 or 40: it mills 20. When a card mentions it's own name in the text, it refers only to itself, not to other copies.

Posted By: kikukillerofkings82 (8/30/2009 3:31:58 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Nemesis of Reason, much like Grimoire Thief, is one of those cards that forces your opponent to deal with it. If he can't, it's game over, which makes this a great mid-to-end game card. Grimoire Thief is slightly better because of its early playability and the absolute necessity for your opponent to take attention and waste a turn dealing with it which can give you a huge leg up in turn advantage. That aside, Nemesis of Reason has the raw power to be a great finisher, which should give it consideration to anyone playing U/B, not just the mill crowd.
posts.html:
Nemesis of Reason, much like Grimoire Thief, is one of those cards that forces your opponent to deal with it. If he can't, it's game over, which makes this a great mid-to-end game card. Grimoire Thief is slightly better because of its early playability and the absolute necessity for your opponent to take attention and waste a turn dealing with it which can give you a huge leg up in turn advantage. That aside, Nemesis of Reason has the raw power to be a great finisher, which should give it consideration to anyone playing U/B, not just the mill crowd.

posts.post_content: The weak art on this card is the epitome of wasted potential, but that won't stop me from putting two of them in my blue/black discard/control deck that i've owned and played since like 1996. This ugly freak will feed the [guiltfeeder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=guiltfeeder)s in that deck like no other, but i'm concerned that it will be overkill. The upside is that the Nemesis is a win condition in itself as it only has to attack six times (five should be enough) to end the game. Removal is always a problem, but [Soul Manipulation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Manipulation) is another solid fit for the deck.
posts.html:
The weak art on this card is the epitome of wasted potential, but that won't stop me from putting two of them in my blue/black discard/control deck that i've owned and played since like 1996. This ugly freak will feed the guiltfeeders in that deck like no other, but i'm concerned that it will be overkill. The upside is that the Nemesis is a win condition in itself as it only has to attack six times (five should be enough) to end the game. Removal is always a problem, but Soul Manipulation is another solid fit for the deck.

posts.post_content: The card is really great buy the huge issue is it is subject to spells like Terminate etc...It needs shroud but I wonder If that would be to overboard. Either way you can use Robe of Mirrors for the cost of one to make it super powerful or protective bubble. But my suggestion to use Nemesis is in a milling deck/hand combo deck black and blue. While you tear their hand away early in the game with Duress x4 or Mind Wrench you can also use Brainbite. Use dark ritual early in the game to squeeze more Duresses or other hand milling you think is better. Then on your fourth or third turn bust out a dark ritual and mill their hand with a Duress and use the extra to bring out Nemesis. Even if they have counters use Raise Dead x4 some cards that bring back creatures or other spells are too expensive so I suggest low cost spells like Raise Dead or use Countersquall and Counterspell. On an added note do what I did and add x4 Nemesis x4 Duress x4 Raise Dead x1 Damnation x4 Counterspell x4 Coun... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

Either way you can use Robe of Mirrors for the cost of one to make it super powerful or protective bubble. But my suggestion to use Nemesis is in a milling deck/hand combo deck black and blue. While you tear their hand away early in the game with Duress x4 or Mind Wrench you can also use Brainbite. Use dark ritual early in the game to squeeze more Duresses or other hand milling you think is better. Then on your fourth or third turn bust out a dark ritual and mill their hand with a Duress and use the extra to bring out Nemesis. Even if they have counters use Raise Dead x4 some cards that bring back creatures or other spells are too expensive so I suggest low cost spells like Raise Dead or use Countersquall and Counterspell. On an added note do what I did and add x4 Nemesis x4 Duress x4 Raise Dead x1 Damnation x4 Counterspell x4 Coun... (see all)
